description: President-elect Donald Trump said he will appoint Andrew N. Ferguson to be the next chair of the Federal Trade Commission, according to a post on Truth Social.
title: Trump Picks Andrew Ferguson for FTC Chair

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has proposed a reduction of the value-added tax on basic groceries to help low-income households cope with persistently high inflation.
title: German Leader Scholz Backs Lower Grocery Taxes as Election Nears

description: Australia selected 19 projects in its biggest renewable-energy tender yet, as part of plans to stimulate a world-leading transition away from an aging fleet of coal-fired plants.
title: Australia Picks BP, Neoen Projects in Biggest Renewables Tender

description: Various trade unions criticized the UK government over public sector pay proposals for next year, raising the prospect of potential industrial action and tensions that would be a blow to Keir Starmer’s administration.
title: Unions Slam UK Proposals on Public Pay in Fresh Risk for Starmer

description: China is set to begin its annual economic work meeting on Wednesday to map out policies for next year, with top leaders hinting at more forceful stimulus amid the threat of a potential trade war with the US.
title: China Begins Annual Economic Meeting to Hash Out Stimulus Plan

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, politics editor Laura Davison looks at how Congress may look at tariffs and taxes next year. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Republicans Strategize on Trump’s Tax and Tariff Plans

description: Northern Ireland lawmakers voted to continue applying post-Brexit rules, but opposition from unionist parties underscored the challenge facing the UK government as it tries to maintain political stability in the region.
title: Northern Ireland Backs Post-Brexit Rules But Unionists Protest

description: Romania’s pro-European parties pledged to move quickly to form a new government to keep the far-right out of power and to call fresh presidential elections after the previous ballot was annulled by the country’s top court.
title: Romanian Pro-European Parties Pledge to Form Government Quickly

description: It was an unfortunate gaffe for a leftist government to make in the current political climate. With President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva out of commission, his stand-in met a leader from eastern Europe and referred to him as the head of a country that has melted away after the collapse of the Soviet Union three decades ago.
title: Lula’s Stand-In Thinks Long-Gone Yugoslavia Is Still a Country

description: President Joe Biden plans to formally block the $14.1 billion sale of United States Steel Corp. to Nippon Steel Corp. on national security grounds once the deal is referred back to him later this month, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Biden Plans to Finally Kill Nippon Steel Bid for US Steel

description: Donald Trump’s criminal conviction in his New York hush-money case can’t be dismissed as a result of his election victory and must instead be preserved during his upcoming presidency, Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg told a judge.
title: Trump’s Hush-Money Conviction Must Be Preserved, DA Tells Judge

description: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell fell Tuesday and cut his face, but a colleague said he is “fine” after receiving medical attention.
title: Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell ‘Fine’ Following Fall

description: President-elect Donald Trump said his administration would help expedite permits for any person or company that invested at least $1 billion in the US.
title: Trump Vows Fast Permits for Those Investing $1 Billion in US

description: French political turmoil has driven uncertainty in industry and construction to levels not seen since the energy crisis in 2022, extending a shadow over the country’s economic outlook.
title: France’s Political Storm Stokes Uncertain Business Outlook

description: President Joe Biden warned that Republican Donald Trump’s plans to extend tax cuts and reshape global trade through tariffs risked reversing economic gains, even as dissatisfaction with his own handling of the economy contributed to last month’s stinging electoral loss.
title: Biden Defends Economic Record, Says Trump Plans Threaten Growth

description: Negotiators for the world’s largest economies reached broad consensus to back South Africa’s G-20 priorities, including addressing the worryingly high debt of African nations.
title: G-20 Negotiators Back South Africa’s Push to Tackle Continent’s Debt

description: An additional 10 or 12 US-made Patriot air defense systems could help Ukraine secure its skies and change the balance of power in Russia’s war on the country, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy told reporters in Kyiv.
title: Zelenskiy Says More Patriot Air Defense Systems Could Change Course of War

description: The US Treasury Department said Tuesday it disbursed a $20 billion loan to support Ukraine, which will be repaid using the profits generated from immobilized Russian central bank assets.
title: US Disburses $20 Billion Ukraine Loan Backed by Russian Assets

description: The UK should lead a push for Europe to pay more into NATO given France and Germany are grappling political instability on the eve of Donald Trump’s return to power, US ambassador to the UK Jane Hartley said.
title: UK Should Lead Push on NATO Spending in Europe, US Envoy Says

description: Struggling colleges show the early impact of an immigration pullback, a major policy reversal by Justin Trudeau’s government
title: Immigration Whiplash Hits Canada’s Colleges in Warning for Economy

description: House Speaker Mike Johnson signaled on Tuesday that the current Congress is unlikely to act on legislation to protect children from online exploitation and bullying despite a deal supporters negotiated with Elon Musk’s X social media platform.
title: House Speaker Mike Johnson Signals Delaying Action on Kids Online Safety Act

description: French President Emmanuel Macron is seeking to free his government from the stranglehold of National Rally leader Marine Le Pen by piecing together a coalition of moderates that will last until 2027.
title: Macron Aims to Deter French Far Right With Bid to Avoid Vote

description: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu’s proposal to temporarily increase commercial property taxes has failed after months of debate between lawmakers and business groups.
title: Boston Mayor’s Plan to Raise Commercial Taxes Fails in Massachusetts Senate

description: The UK is considering participating in a €1.5 billion ($1.6 billion) fund being set up by the European Union to bolster the regional defense industry, people familiar with the matter said.
title: UK Explores Joining €1.5 Billion EU Fund to Boost Defense Sector

description: Rising inflation, a falling approval rating and a sharply divided country had put Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on the cusp of the most difficult chapter of his long years in office even before he underwent emergency brain surgery.
title: Lula Faces Biden Parallels as Surgery Raises Questions Over Age

description: The Biden administration and President-elect Donald Trump have both stressed that they don’t want to get deeply involved in the unfolding chaos in Syria. They may not have a choice.
title: Terror Risks Make Syria Impossible to Ignore for Biden and Trump

description: There is a famous saying attributed to Henry Kissinger, though denied by the man, that goes something like, “Who do I call if I want to speak to Europe?” When it comes to getting Donald Trump’s attention, the competition is heating up.
title: Orban, Macron, Meloni Compete for Trump’s Ear as Europe’s Voice

description: The Biden administration has reached a final agreement to give Micron Corp. nearly $6.2 billion in subsidies from a program designed to boost American semiconductor manufacturing, allowing funds to start flowing to factories in Idaho and New York.
title: Micron Gets $6.2 Billion Chips Award to Spur Plant Construction

description: Canadian Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland said the government will keep its goal of reducing its debt-to-GDP ratio over time, but sidestepped questions about the size of the budget deficit.
title: Freeland Says Canada to Meet Debt Goal, Stays Quiet on Deficit

description: Italy is preparing to sell a minority stake in rail operator Ferrovie dello Stato Italiane SpA as the government looks to dispose of assets to cut debt.
title: Italy Is Planning to Sell Off a Minority Stake in Rail Operator Ferrovie

description: Peace talks on the war in Ukraine might start this winter, Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said on Tuesday.
title: Poland’s Tusk Says Ukraine Peace Talks Might Start in Winter

description: Romanian authorities raced to piece together how a little-known pro-Russian candidate won the first round of a presidential election that’s now been annulled as they carried out a crackdown of surging extremist forces.
title: Romania Is Out to Prove Its Election Was Worth Cancelling

description: Some of the world’s most powerful and influential money managers said they’re not convinced that President-Elect Donald Trump’s potentially wide-ranging tariffs are much more than a negotiating tactic.
title: Money Managers Cast Doubt on Economic Impact of Trump’s Tariffs

description: The Belgian-based clearinghouse that’s holding the bulk of frozen assets from Russia’s central bank said that it shouldn’t be held liable if the European Union decides to confiscate the assets to help Ukraine.
title: Euroclear Warns of Liability Risk in Confiscating Russian Assets

description: Fighter jets and bomb blasts are hitting Syria again as Israel, determined to keep former President Bashar al-Assad’s abandoned arsenals out of rebel hands, conducts unprecedented rounds of preemptive strikes.
title: Unprecedented Israeli Strikes on Weapons Sites Shake Syria

description: Government borrowing habits pose the biggest danger to world economic stability and recent shifts in market sentiment should serve as a warning, the Bank for International Settlements said.
title: Fiscal Debt Binge Is World’s Biggest Stability Threat, BIS Says

description: A Zambian court ruled that former President Edgar Lungu cannot stand in future elections for the nation’s top office, as he has already held it twice.
title: Court Finds Zambia Ex-President Lungu Ineligible for Re-Election

description: When the International Monetary Fund chief visited Cairo last month, she found herself staring at Egypt in the form of a huge woven wall map, whose intricacy could be a metaphor for her delicate task across the Arab world.
title: Syria Shows How Middle East Can’t Take Stability for Granted

description: US small-business optimism surged in November to a more than three-year high in anticipation of more favorable economic policies after Donald Trump sealed his return to the White House.
title: US Small-Business Optimism Soars to Three-Year-High After Trump Win

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Assad’s Fall Is a Big Win for Turkey’s Erdogan

description: Group of Seven leaders are willing to support a new Syrian government if the transition process respects the rule of law as well as religious and ethnic minorities in the country.
title: G-7 to Endorse Syria-Led Transition Process After Fall of Assad

description: Companies say they confront multiple obstacles to reshoring production, from environmental regulations to labor shortages.
title: Trump’s Manufacturing Revival Doesn’t Add Up for These Businesses

description: South Korea’s metal workers will stage a strike Wednesday, joining the nationwide protest seeking the resignation of President Yoon Suk Yeol who narrowly survived in an impeachment vote.
title: South Korea’s Metal Workers Call Strike in Push For Yoon’s Exit

description: France needs to push on with plans to lower its debt load and narrow its deficit, according to European Economics Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis.
title: France Must Push on With Debt, Deficit Plans, Dombrovskis Says

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is set to take the witness stand for the first time in a corruption trial in which he’s accused of bribery, fraud and breach of trust, a case that’s played havoc with the nation’s political life for nearly a decade.
title: Netanyahu Takes the Witness Stand in Historic Corruption Trial

description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is in the intensive care unit of the Sírio-Libanês hospital in São Paulo after undergoing emergency surgery, according to an official statement from the hospital.
title: Brazil’s Lula in Intensive Care After Brain Surgery

description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier’s outgoing administration will present a stopgap spending bill to the full cabinet on Wednesday, to ensure the country can continue operating without a proper 2025 budget come January.
title: France to Present Stopgap Spending Bill to Cabinet on Wednesday

description: South Sudanese President Salva Kiir replaced the heads of key institutions after recent tension within the East African nation’s security structures.
title: South Sudan President Appoints New Security, Central Bank Chiefs

description: Israel stepped up its attacks on military sites in Syria, striking some 250 targets early Tuesday, according to media reports and a war monitor.
title: Israel Steps Up Airstrikes on Military Sites in Syria

description: Northvolt’s cash crunch and local factories getting canceled undermine the region’s push to reduce reliance on Asia.
title: Europe’s Big Battery Ambitions Are Failing, and China Is Benefiting

description: Viktor Orban’s critics have been waiting for years for a figure to credibly challenge his increasingly autocratic rule in Hungary. Few would have bet on Peter Magyar to be that person.
title: Hungarian Politics Has a New Star and It’s Not Viktor Orban

description: Emmanuel Macron will bring together a broad group of political parties for a meeting on Tuesday, in an effort to find a new prime minister to replace Michel Barnier, whose government was ousted last week over a budget dispute.
title: Macron Widens Talks in Quest for Stable French Government

description: Germany should step up its defense spending to set an example for the European Union as doubts grow about US military support for Ukraine, a senior Polish defense official said.
title: Poland Calls on Germany to Show Leadership With Defense Spending

description: Of all the winners and losers from Syria’s sudden change of power, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan stands out as among those with the most to gain.
title: With Assad’s Fall, Erdogan Oversees Turkey’s Growing Regional Clout

description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said he is ready to face any potential criminal probe over his handling of a sovereignty dispute with neighboring Singapore over an island.
title: Mahathir Ready for Criminal Probe Over Singapore Island Dispute

description: Luigi Mangione was charged with murder in New York for the fatal shooting of UnitedHealth Group Inc.’s insurance chief Brian Thompson on a midtown Manhattan sidewalk, according to the New York State court system’s website.
title: UnitedHealth Exec Shooting Suspect Charged With Murder in New York

description: Pete Hegseth said President-elect Donald Trump urged him to “keep fighting” in his quest to become the next secretary of Defense, as a key meeting appeared to bolster his path to confirmation.
title: Pete Hegseth Says Trump Tells Him to ‘Keep Fighting’ for Defense Post

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said his nation won’t deploy Navy warships to the South China Sea in response to recent clashes with Beijing in disputed waters.
title: Marcos Says Philippines Won’t Send Warships After China Clashes

description: South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung sought to force through a highly contested budget Tuesday in a show of political clout as he seeks to build momentum for another impeachment bid against President Yoon Suk Yeol in the coming days.
title: South Korea’s Opposition to Force Through Budget in a Power Play

description: Asian economies are resilient enough to ride out turbulence, International Monetary Fund economists said, underscoring the importance of taking turmoils in stride at a time when the region faces various internal risks in addition to Donald Trump’s return to the White House.
title: Asian Economies Resilient Enough to Endure Turbulence, IMF Says

description: The Bank of Japan should raise its benchmark interest rate early, and it faces the risk it has already fallen behind the curve, according to a prominent economics professor who was an adviser to the prime minister.
title: BOJ Should Hike Given Risk of Falling Behind, Top Academic Says

description: Malaysian lawmakers voted in favor of broadening the government’s control over the internet, unmoved by criticism that the law risks suppressing dissent and free speech.
title: Malaysian Lawmakers Approve Bill to Broaden Internet Control

description: Valedictorian at his $37,000-a-year all-boys prep school. Founder of a gaming club and graduate at an Ivy League university. A rapidly ascending data engineer at TrueCar Inc.
title: CEO Murder Suspect Was Ivy League Graduate Who Praised Unabomber

description: Seoul’s cityscape has transformed into a glittering color display marrying K-pop and politics, with scores of music fans singing in the streets and waving glow sticks in protest of President Yoon Suk Yeol.
title: K-Pop Light Sticks Unite South Korea's Anti-Yoon Protesters

description: President-elect Donald Trump has endorsed KC Crosbie as a co-chair of the Republican National Committee, after his daughter-in-law stepped aside amid speculation about a future post in the Senate.
title: Trump Endorses RNC Successor to Lara Trump Amid Talk of Senate Seat

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he met with President-elect Donald Trump on Monday, a sit-down between two populist leaders that could spur worries in some foreign capitals about Trump’s approach to the war in Ukraine.
title: Hungary’s Orban Says He Met With Trump, Musk at Mar-a-Lago
